item.title: Aeroponic project
item.description: Why the project? In those days we have to think about the future. If we want to slow down our pollution rate, we have to change our way of thinking an our way of living. In north country like Canada, we depend on south country to feed us. The transport of our food is done by truck over thousands of kilometers. Thus, our food is no longer totally fresh. Furthermore, the pollution produced by these transport is not negligible.

item.title: Parts
item.description: The systeme overall For an aeroponic systeme you need a pump, a shut off valve, a presurized water tank, tubing, fittings, solenoid valves, microcontroler or timer, net pot, plants container, water tank. Pump: Aquatec 8800 High Flow Booster Pump CDP-HFO 3/8"JG-110BP-24V AC Universal Plate +Aquatec Transformers For 8800 Series Booster Pumps 120V Presurized water tank: In Line Check Valve: tubing: John Guest 3/8” and 1/4” Polyethylene Tubing fitting: John Guest PI Series Connectors

item.title: User interface
item.description: First version of the user interface The main window In this window you can access command graphics or the system map. The command window If you want to change cycle time or open/close one valve to check if all works. Whith that it’s easier to see if there is clogged foggers I don’t have to restart my arduino or wait for another cycle. The map window On this window you have all the sensors real time data.

item.title: Aeroponic letuces evolution
item.description: Crops evolution I started my seedlings on December 14th 2020. In December th I planted the seedlings in mineral cubes and put them under LED light. One weed later December 29th, I put the cubes in the plant baskets and placed them in my containers.You can see the evolutions on the pictures below. December 14, 2020 I tried 4 kinds of letuces but the one presented here are the “Grosse Blonde Paresseuse”.
